contest-event.event-date:
Jan. 15, 2017 D Butlins Mineworkers (Championship Section)
Butlins Mineworkers (Championship Section) 1 Set Test and Entertainments Contest Butlins Mineworkers butlins-mineworkers-championship-section
Championship
Own Choice and Entertainments Contest
Butlins Skegness (Centre Stage), Skegness, Lincolnshire, England, UK Highest placed mining band: Desford Colliery Most entertaining band: Friary Guildford Geoff Dove soloist award: Paul RIchards, soprano cornet, Flowers Band Butlins Award for Services to Banding: Richard Evans
Adjudication / Scoring Note: Scoring format has changed from previous years: Bands were given 3 separate placings for Test Piece, Music (Ents programme) and Entertainment. Overall result was just the 3 placings added together. Time penalty would have been -1 place rather than loss of points, but it didn't affect any band this year; the tie-breaker for overall placings (as with Friary & Woodfalls) was the Entertainment result.
Jan. 24, 2016, 4:41 p.m. May 9, 2017, 11:48 a.m.
1 The GUS Band Adam Cooke Journey of the Lone Wolf
2 Flowers Band Paul Holland Spiriti
3 Desford Colliery Band Michael Fowles The Triumph of Time
4 Friary Brass Band Chris King Metropolis 1927
5 Woodfalls Band Nigel Seaman Journey of the Lone Wolf
6 Redbridge Brass Jeremy Wise Fraternity
7 Jaguar Land Rover Band Dave Lea Of Distant Memories
8 Haverhill Silver Band Mark Ager Isaiah 40
